meanings.definition: The quality or state of being black.
meanings.sent1: Her beautiful negritude shone brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the essence of negritude in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The negritude of the night sky was a stark contrast to the twinkling stars.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of colors, her negritude stood out like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The negritude of the ebony statue was striking against the white walls.

meanings.definition: A literary and ideological movement among black French-speaking Africans and those of African descent in the 1930s and 1940s.
meanings.sent1: The negritude movement aimed to celebrate African culture and heritage.
meanings.sent2: Many poets and writers were inspired by the ideals of negritude.
meanings.sent3: The negritude gathering was filled with laughter and lively discussions.
meanings.sent4: Her words carried the spirit of negritude, resonating with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The negritude movement sparked a wave of creativity and self-expression.
